content.description: After a discouraging boulder problem off the ground, the route pulls onto a ledge and into a juggy stem corner. Work your way through the easy climbing to a delicate finish on small holds.
content.protection: 6 bolts to Metolius rap hangers. Rappel to lower.
content.location: Just about the midway point of the Bitch Magnet area. Look for a broad ledge beneath an obtuse, left-facing corner.

content.description: An ugly duckling of the Projects area. Flowers and Bunnies climbs an easy, juggy slab for the first three bolts, until you're forced to climb the narrow ramp. Teeter your way up the ramp, looking left, right, up, down, and deep inside yourself for hidden holds. You may not like it, but that's okay. Someday, he'll be a swan.
content.location: Flowers and Bunnies is the furthest-uphill route of the Bitch Magnet area. It climbs the right-leaning ramp to a chunky ledge finish.

content.description: Brother Speed features long, powerful moves between flakes, edges, and pockets, separated by decent rests. Two distinct cruxes guard the chains: a long, lateral reach to an undercling pocket at the fourth bolt, and a dynamic pull to gain the final bolt. Excellent positions and challenging movement.
content.location: Brother Speed is located on the furthest uphill section of the Bitch Magnet area, immediately left of the route Bitch Magnet. The route begins on the steep wall (~20 degrees overhanging) left of a slabby, right-trending ramp. Stem up a short corner and clip the first bolt from a spade-shaped, downward-pointing fin of rock about 10 feet off the ground. The route climbs directly through two large huecos.

content.description: Walk up the left-facing ramp and lean over to clip the first bolt. Walk up a bit more, grab the bucket, clip the second bolt, and get down to business. Make a few big crosses and long moves between huge pockets and get ready for the crux at the last bolt.  Crank down on a few crimps, paddle helplessly at the footholds like you were tossed into the pool for a swimming lesson, and lunge for the jug to finish it up. Great climbing!
content.location: Second to last climb on the wall. Starts off of the final ramp by pulling into a distinctive smattering of big pockets.
